title: Abu Bakr
summary: Abu Bakr al-Siddiq (Arabic: أَبُو بَكْرٍ الصديق‎, romanized: Abū Bakr al-Ṣiddīq; 27 October 573 – 23 August 634) was an Arab political and religious leader who founded the Rashidun Caliphate and ruled as its first caliph from 632 until his death in 634. He was the most prominent companion, closest advisor and a father-in-law of the Islamic prophet Muhammad. Abu Bakr is one of the most important figures in Sunni Islam.
